title: Unauthenticated arbitrary file upload on the https://█████/ (█████.mil)
content:
Description
I was able to identify unsafe upload endpoint on the https://██████/upload.php
POC
1) Go to the https://██████/upload.php
2) Upload some test file.
You will see success message, leaking some internal paths
3) Visit https://██████████/delete.me and you will see your uploaded file there
I uploaded example image file there:
█████
Impact
Arbitrary file upload, may lead to the Stored XSS, hosting attacker's content and code execution.
steps: Upload a test file and note the success message revealing internal paths
Visit https://██████████/delete.me to confirm the file was uploaded
vuln_description: An unauthenticated arbitrary file upload vulnerability was found on the target site, allowing attackers to upload files without authentication. This could lead to stored XSS, hosting malicious content, or even remote code execution.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to discover as it involves a direct file upload endpoint without authentication checks. The steps to reproduce are simple and do not require complex interactions or state manipulation.
